instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi and crashes after waterdamage
threads.message:
Hello,
i am working on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. It was waterdamaged and stuck st 5V. I fixed that (Short on <SIGNAL>V3_S2</SIGNAL> near UL000 ). I also fixed other minor waterdamage on UD560, UD550, UC300, <TRANSISTOR>Q5240</TRANSISTOR>, UP700. After that it turned back on and i could download (via RJ45) and reinstall macOS. But it always crashes after a minute or two. I neede several times to complete the startup setup and now i can enter the OS. There is no Wifi hardware detected and i am wondering if the Wifi IC is damaged and if it can be fiexd as it is married to the board if im right. Or is that the wrong path?
Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi and crashes after waterdamage
threads.message:
The wifi chip is tied to MLB, no way to change it (yet).
You can try to reball it, in case of accumulated crap underneath.
Check all traces and solders in its area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi and crashes after waterdamage
threads.message: Ok, Thank you. Ill try to reall it. If it wont work is it possible to use the board without the IC (and without wifi)? I read about this possibility in another forum but not sure if its reliable...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi and crashes after waterdamage
threads.message: If machine doesn't restart now, you can use it with USB wifi adapter I suppose.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi and crashes after waterdamage
threads.message:
I was working on this device and encountered some intersting new facts. Maybe this helps point in some direction.

- I cut <SIGNAL>3V3_S2</SIGNAL> (the previously next to UL000 shorted line) power traces to the Wifi IC (as its easier to undo than removing it and should have the same effect). Still crashing.
-If it crashes it shows a purple screen for 1 second, shuts down and even resets the charger after this. AMP-meter thrning off, automatically restarts beginning at 5V, 20V, boot, crash... So thats some kind of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> (or SMC-like) reset?
-Plugged in if i turn it off by holding Power button for 7 seconds it also resets the charger and turns itself back on.
- Also the Touchbar is not working - even in the OS.
- Last thing i came across it that it also crashes in save mode (its still loading a lot of drivers in this mode) but NOT in recovery mode. I can use Drive-utility, safari and even reinstall the OS (using RJ45 adapter) for hours no problem. So it seems to be depending on a specific driver thats beeing loaded at some point.

You got any idea what could cause this/if i could use this device in any other mode or with another operating system maybe?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi and crashes after waterdamage
threads.message:
Change security settings accordingly and test with Windows, or/and Linux.

Read something more about UL000 (and M1 in general) here:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/M1_MacBooks[/URL]
You may try to recover it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi and crashes after waterdamage
threads.message:
I am not very familiar with there "newer" devices. What settings need to be changed and how to do it? I only once installed windows on a 2017 Touchbar intel device.
Good to hear that the article seems to be a reliable source. I found it last week and cut the power traces to UL000 on <SIGNAL>3V3_S2</SIGNAL> addordingly to this article on friday but no change unfortunately. Now i hope another OS micht work as it stays on in recovery mode...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi and crashes after waterdamage
